intro: Leitneria floridana, commonly known as the Florida flame flower, is a unique plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in swampy areas along the coasts of Florida. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
